Based on your preferences, I would recommend "The Last Samurai" as a potential recommendation.

This film follows the story of a samurai who becomes disillusioned with his traditional way of life and decides to become a Westerner and adopt modern technology and ways of living in order to find fulfillment and meaning in his life. 

Throughout the film, we see the struggles that the samurai faces as he tries to adapt to modern Western ways of living. We also see the toll that this struggle takes on the samurai's physical and mental well-being.

Overall, I believe that "The Last Samurai" is a highly recommended film for those who are interested in historical films that explore themes related to traditional vs. modern ways of living, cultural differences, and personal growth and development.
